definitions: To find out or establish exactly, typically as a result of research or calculation.
To cause (something) to occur in a particular way; to be the decisive factor in.
To decide or settle (a dispute or question) conclusively.
To officially decide and state (especially in a court of law).
examples: Scientists determine the age of artifacts.
The outcome of the election will determine the country's future.
The court will determine the validity of the contract.
Factors like diet and exercise determine one's health.
